sentences.sContent: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.sCn: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.sContent: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.sCn: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.sContent: ...this is the first time a panel has been designed to be laid directly on top existing roads and the first project to install the panels on public highways...
...The panels are also designed so that they can be installed directly on top of the existing roadways...
...They’ll be able to answer the questions of students who are in their class directly via the interactive book...
...boats and other assets directly from each other...
...listeners are considered disrespectful if they look directly at the speaker...
...The most obvious problem is that it might give museums a very heavy economic burden which directly impedes the sustainable development of these organizations...

...The idea behind the program is to get the police officers out of their cars and into our neighborhoods where they can talk directly to merchants and residents about the real dynamics of our city...
...it’s difficult to know whether to approach the child directly or the parent first...

synos.tran: 直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

words.tran: 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的
直接地；正好；按直系关系

trans.tranOther: with no other person, action, process etc between
